title: Everything, and nothing, is black and white in US elections
content: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.
summary: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.

title: Trump says Zuckerberg called, apologized for 'censoring' photo: 'He's not gonna support a Democrat'
content: "First he called me after the incident (assassination bid) and said it was very brave. He actually announced he is not gonna support a Democrat because he can't because he respected me for what I did that day. What I did that day was a normal response to me. But I was called by Mark Zuckerberg yesterday, the day before on the same subject and he actually apologized and said that he had made a mistake..."Trump said adding that nobody called from Google.
summary: "First he called me after the incident (assassination bid) and said it was very brave. He actually announced he is not gonna support a Democrat because he can't because he respected me for what I did that day. What I did that day was a normal response to me. But I was called by Mark Zuckerberg yesterday, the day before on the same subject and he actually apologized and said that he had made a mistake..."Trump said adding that nobody called from Google.

title: 'If a leader leaves, another will arise': Hamas chief Haniyeh's last words before assassination in Israeli strike
content: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in an Israeli strike in Tehran after quoting a Koranic verse to Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei. His death marks the third assassination of a Hamas leader by Israel in two decades. Haniyeh advocated resistance against Israel and strengthened Hamas' ties with Iran to bolster military capabilities.
summary: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated in an Israeli strike in Tehran after quoting a Koranic verse to Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei. His death marks the third assassination of a Hamas leader by Israel in two decades. Haniyeh advocated resistance against Israel and strengthened Hamas' ties with Iran to bolster military capabilities.

title: Watch: Biden says 'you're stuck with me for another 100, 90 days'. 'There's no way out
content: As President Joe Biden and vide president Kamala Harris welcomed the three freed hostages from Russia, Biden told reporters 'you're stuck with me as president for a while, kid'. "There's no way out, OK? You've got me for at least another 100, 90 days or so," Biden said when he was asked how important it was to secure the release as he is not running for re-election.
summary: As President Joe Biden and vide president Kamala Harris welcomed the three freed hostages from Russia, Biden told reporters 'you're stuck with me as president for a while, kid'. "There's no way out, OK? You've got me for at least another 100, 90 days or so," Biden said when he was asked how important it was to secure the release as he is not running for re-election.

title: UK police brace for planned far-right protests
content: UK police prepared for more far-right protests after a mass stabbing killed three young girls in Southport. Security tightened at mosques due to fears of anti-Islamic attacks. Prime Minister Starmer condemned agitators and promised legal action. Demonstrations are expected across various cities, including London and Cardiff, with authorities ready to respond.
summary: UK police prepared for more far-right protests after a mass stabbing killed three young girls in Southport. Security tightened at mosques due to fears of anti-Islamic attacks. Prime Minister Starmer condemned agitators and promised legal action. Demonstrations are expected across various cities, including London and Cardiff, with authorities ready to respond.

title: 'Disappointing...disgusting': Donald Trump's son on cousin's book; Mary shuts him down
content: Donald Trump's son Eric Trump said it's disappointing that Fred decided to 'cash in' less than 100 days before the election. Eric said his father Donald Trump provided endless financial support to Fred for his son's treatment but Fred decided to forget everything for some quick buck. Fred's journey down memory lane includes when he heard uncle Donald to say the N word, when uncle told him that he should let his disabled son die and then move to Florida etc. Fred also said he would vote for Kamala Harris as his uncle is 'atomic crazy'.
summary: Donald Trump's son Eric Trump said it's disappointing that Fred decided to 'cash in' less than 100 days before the election. Eric said his father Donald Trump provided endless financial support to Fred for his son's treatment but Fred decided to forget everything for some quick buck. Fred's journey down memory lane includes when he heard uncle Donald to say the N word, when uncle told him that he should let his disabled son die and then move to Florida etc. Fred also said he would vote for Kamala Harris as his uncle is 'atomic crazy'.

title: US extends hiring cooldown while unemployment highest since 2021
content: The US job market showed significant cooling in July with a rise in the unemployment rate to 4.3 percent, its highest level since late 2021. The economy added 114,000 jobs, down from June's revised figure of 179,000. This development brings the Federal Reserve closer to considering its first post-pandemic interest rate cut.
summary: The US job market showed significant cooling in July with a rise in the unemployment rate to 4.3 percent, its highest level since late 2021. The economy added 114,000 jobs, down from June's revised figure of 179,000. This development brings the Federal Reserve closer to considering its first post-pandemic interest rate cut.

title: France demands release of citizen Vinatier held in Russia
content: France demanded Russia release French researcher Laurent Vinatier following a significant prisoner exchange. Vinatier faces up to five years in prison after pleading guilty to not registering as a foreign agent. The French foreign ministry also called for the immediate release of other arbitrarily detained individuals in Russia as they welcomed the release of 16 prisoners.
summary: France demanded Russia release French researcher Laurent Vinatier following a significant prisoner exchange. Vinatier faces up to five years in prison after pleading guilty to not registering as a foreign agent. The French foreign ministry also called for the immediate release of other arbitrarily detained individuals in Russia as they welcomed the release of 16 prisoners.

title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen in attack on Judges' escort in Northwest Pakistan
content: Militants attacked a convoy of judges returning home after duty hours in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, on Friday. No casualties or injuries were reported as police engaged the attackers. This incident is part of a surge in terror attacks in the region, with Pakistan witnessing 1,514 such attacks in 2023, resulting in 2,922 casualties.
summary: Militants attacked a convoy of judges returning home after duty hours in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, on Friday. No casualties or injuries were reported as police engaged the attackers. This incident is part of a surge in terror attacks in the region, with Pakistan witnessing 1,514 such attacks in 2023, resulting in 2,922 casualties.

title: 'Now that Jennifer Aniston is such a...': Megyn Kelly on Imane Khelif row
content: ​Journalist Megyn Kelly slammed at actor Jennifer Aniston questioning her silence on Italian boxer Angela Carini who was hit by Algeria's Imane Khelif triggering the biggest row of Olympics 2024. Imane has been alleged to be a 'biological male' but she has been participating in women's match. With the issue raging on social media, Megyn Kelly said she is looking forward to Jennifer Aniston's comments like the actor weighed in to slam Republican senator JD Vance's comments on 'childless cat ladies'.
summary: ​Journalist Megyn Kelly slammed at actor Jennifer Aniston questioning her silence on Italian boxer Angela Carini who was hit by Algeria's Imane Khelif triggering the biggest row of Olympics 2024. Imane has been alleged to be a 'biological male' but she has been participating in women's match. With the issue raging on social media, Megyn Kelly said she is looking forward to Jennifer Aniston's comments like the actor weighed in to slam Republican senator JD Vance's comments on 'childless cat ladies'.

title: Senior leader of Imran Khan's party shot dead in Lahore
content: A senior leader of former prime minister Imran Khan's PTI party, Dr Shahid Saddique Khan, was fatally shot in Lahore after Friday prayers. Four unidentified assailants attacked him outside a mosque. Despite being taken to a hospital, he succumbed to his injuries. A special police team has been formed to investigate the incident.
summary: A senior leader of former prime minister Imran Khan's PTI party, Dr Shahid Saddique Khan, was fatally shot in Lahore after Friday prayers. Four unidentified assailants attacked him outside a mosque. Despite being taken to a hospital, he succumbed to his injuries. A special police team has been formed to investigate the incident.

title: At least two policemen killed in terror attack on judges' convoy in northwest Pakistan
content: Two police officers were killed and two others injured in an ambush by terrorists on a judges' convoy in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Despite tight security, militants attacked while the convoy was en route from Tank district courts to Dera Ismail Khan. Clashes continued between police and militants. The judges remained safe.
summary: Two police officers were killed and two others injured in an ambush by terrorists on a judges' convoy in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Despite tight security, militants attacked while the convoy was en route from Tank district courts to Dera Ismail Khan. Clashes continued between police and militants. The judges remained safe.

title: Jailed former Pak PM Imran Khan's party vows to form 'grand opposition alliance' against ruling PML-N govt
content: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan, currently jailed, approved the expansion of Tehreek Tahafuz-e-Ayin-e-Pakistan to form a grand opposition alliance against the incumbent government. PTI leaders, addressing reporters, called for a strong opposition movement and criticized the current government for high power bills and inflation. The opposition plans a major rally in Swabi on August 5.
summary: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan, currently jailed, approved the expansion of Tehreek Tahafuz-e-Ayin-e-Pakistan to form a grand opposition alliance against the incumbent government. PTI leaders, addressing reporters, called for a strong opposition movement and criticized the current government for high power bills and inflation. The opposition plans a major rally in Swabi on August 5.

title: Russian drone hits bus in Kharkiv region, injuring six, official says
content: A Russian drone attack in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Friday injured six construction workers, with one critically injured, according to the regional governor. The incident occurred near Derhachi, close to where Russia began a new offensive in May. Ukraine halted the advance with reinforcements after Russia pushed into the border areas.
summary: A Russian drone attack in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Friday injured six construction workers, with one critically injured, according to the regional governor. The incident occurred near Derhachi, close to where Russia began a new offensive in May. Ukraine halted the advance with reinforcements after Russia pushed into the border areas.

title: European Holocaust Remembrance Day for Sinti and Roma
content: In 1944, Nazi forces executed around 4,300 Sinti and Roma prisoners in Auschwitz-Birkenau, marking the end of the 'gypsy camp.' The European Union commemorates this event on August 2 as the European Roma Holocaust Memorial Day. Survivors like Christian Pfeil continue to share their stories, emphasizing the importance of remembering this genocide to prevent history from repeating itself.
summary: In 1944, Nazi forces executed around 4,300 Sinti and Roma prisoners in Auschwitz-Birkenau, marking the end of the 'gypsy camp.' The European Union commemorates this event on August 2 as the European Roma Holocaust Memorial Day. Survivors like Christian Pfeil continue to share their stories, emphasizing the importance of remembering this genocide to prevent history from repeating itself.

Turkey bans Instagram without explanation
content: Turkey blocked Instagram without explanation following accusations of censorship by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun. Altun claimed Instagram impeded condolence posts for Hamas official Ismail Haniyeh, killed in Tehran. The Turkish Information Technologies and Communication Authority announced the block, affecting over 50 million Turkish Instagram users. Meta Platforms has not commented on the issue.
summary: Turkey blocked Instagram without explanation following accusations of censorship by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun. Altun claimed Instagram impeded condolence posts for Hamas official Ismail Haniyeh, killed in Tehran. The Turkish Information Technologies and Communication Authority announced the block, affecting over 50 million Turkish Instagram users. Meta Platforms has not commented on the issue.
